comments.body: Where do we track the fixing of the excludes added here?
I have no idea. Moritz just told me to exclude them. I can create a gh issue. However, it would have to be created periodically. I think it needs a discussion and a more general solution.
No idea, my team is not responsible for either canton or the ledger api test tool :shrug:
Maybe @oliverse-da tracks this somewhere
Yes, I track these in canton. Let me take a look at these failing tests.

These tests are likely failing on canton because the canton build has embedded inside it an older version of the ledger api server, i.e. with the next canton release and upgrade in the daml repo, these test should pass again given that it is the ledger api server's `ApiSubmissionService` that now returns `ABORTED`.
Also, created `KVL-876` as a follow-up.
Thanks @hubert-da
Follow-up happening here: https://github.com/digital-asset/daml/pull/9356

```suggestion
    lf_versions = ["stable", "latest"],
```
@oliverse-da could you applied the suggestion when updating canton lib ?

comments.body: I understand this was useful to find the issue, but I don't think it's a good idea to keep this on CI. It would mean that an error on a Canton conformance test would yield _extremely_ long and likely difficult to read logs.

Yeah, I considered this as well - indeed the log file has 300K lines.

I will take a look at how long the log file is if I still only log canton at INFO, but set the DAML-repo classes to log at DEBUG. That ended up being key to tracking down the issue and also those logs are more familiar and easier to read for a "general daml ledger" audience.

Ok, not logging canton at DEBUG gets the log down to about 64K while still providing insights into "reads" performed by the tests. Particularly many of the more "obscure", canton-concept lines (such as those gathering confirmation consensus) are now gone (except for the results logged at info).
Makes sense to me. Thanks for the workaround.
